channel.title: JAZZ EAR TRAINING
channel.itunes:subtitle: exercises to help you take your ear to the next level. Learn to identify complex chords, hear large intervals, recognize any note over any chord and much more...
channel.itunes:author: Danny Wolf

item.title: Episode 11 (root position triads over bass notes)
item.description:
The first section will be major triads over C
the second section will be minor triads over A
item.dc:creator: Danny Wolf
item.itunes:summary:
The first section will be major triads over C
the second section will be minor triads over A

item.title: Episode 10 (melody notes over bass lines)
item.description: In this exercise you need to guess the melody note played on the piano over a given bass line. I will provide the key of the bass line. Later on in the exercise I will give you two notes at the same time.
item.dc:creator: Danny Wolf
item.itunes:summary: In this exercise you need to guess the melody note played on the piano over a given bass line. I will provide the key of the bass line. Later on in the exercise I will give you two notes at the same time.

item.title: Episode 9 (chord Qualities)
item.description: I will play a 4 note voicing consisting of the root, 3rd, 5th, and 7th and you have to guess the quality of the chord. You're choices are major 7, major 7b5, major 7#5, minor/major 7, minor 7, half diminished 7, full diminished 7, dominant 7, dominant 7b5, dominant 7#5. I will play the chord twice, tell you the answer, then arpeggiate the chord
item.dc:creator: Danny Wolf
item.itunes:summary: I will play a 4 note voicing consisting of the root, 3rd, 5th, and 7th and you have to guess the quality of the chord. You're choices are major 7, major 7b5, major 7#5, minor/major 7, minor 7, half diminished 7, full diminished 7, dominant 7, dominant 7b5, dominant 7#5. I will play the chord twice, tell you the answer, then arpeggiate the chord

item.title: Episode 8 part 2 (II-V progressions)
item.description: This is the same exercise as the first part of episode 8 except you will now have to name the last two chords of the progression after hearing the first two.
item.dc:creator: Danny Wolf
item.itunes:summary: This is the same exercise as the first part of episode 8 except you will now have to name the last two chords of the progression after hearing the first two.

item.title: Episode 8 (II - V progressions)
item.description: This exercise will help you to hear II - V progressions. I will play two II - V progressions consecutively and you need to distinguish the interval between them. For example if I give you Dmi7 - G7 - Ebmi7 - Ab7 then the answer would be a half step up because the second II - V progression is a half step up from the first. These different types of progressions are common in jazz music and if you are able to distinguish between them you will have a better understanding of the music and will hopefully allow you to eventually learn jazz tunes by ear.
item.dc:creator: Danny Wolf
item.itunes:summary: This exercise will help you to hear II - V progressions. I will play two II - V progressions consecutively and you need to distinguish the interval between them. For example if I give you Dmi7 - G7 - Ebmi7 - Ab7 then the answer would be a half step up because the second II - V progression is a half step up from the first. These different types of progressions are common in jazz music and if you are able to distinguish between them you will have a better understanding of the music and will hopefully allow you to eventually learn jazz tunes by ear.

item.title: Episode 7 (more interval training)
item.description: This exercise will help you to recognize intervals quickly. I will play a note and you need to guess what it is based on the previous note.
item.dc:creator: Danny Wolf
item.itunes:summary: This exercise will help you to recognize intervals quickly. I will play a note and you need to guess what it is based on the previous note.

item.title: Episode 6 (modes of the major scale)
item.description: I will play a scale based on a mode of the major scale and you have to guess which one it is. You can choose from ionian, dorian, phrygian, lydian, mixolydian, aeolian, locrian.
item.dc:creator: Danny Wolf
item.itunes:summary: I will play a scale based on a mode of the major scale and you have to guess which one it is. You can choose from ionian, dorian, phrygian, lydian, mixolydian, aeolian, locrian.

item.title: Episode 5 (recognizing extensions in dominant chords)
item.description: This exercise will help you to hear all the extensions of a dominant chord. I will play the chord twice; the first time as a block chord, the second time each note separately.
item.dc:creator: Danny Wolf
item.itunes:summary: This exercise will help you to hear all the extensions of a dominant chord. I will play the chord twice; the first time as a block chord, the second time each note separately.

item.title: Episode 4 (singing intervals)
item.description: In this exercise I will tell you what interval to sing from a given note.
item.dc:creator: Danny Wolf
item.itunes:summary: In this exercise I will tell you what interval to sing from a given note.

item.title: Episode 3 (singing melody notes over chords)
item.description: I will play a chord and tell you what that chord is. I will then give you a note that you need to sing over that chord. I will play the chord twice. The first time without the melody note; the second time with the melody note after.
item.dc:creator: Danny Wolf
item.itunes:summary: I will play a chord and tell you what that chord is. I will then give you a note that you need to sing over that chord. I will play the chord twice. The first time without the melody note; the second time with the melody note after.

item.title: Episode 2 (melody notes)
item.description: name the interval between the melody note and the root of the chord
item.dc:creator: Danny Wolf
item.itunes:summary: name the interval between the melody note and the root of the chord

item.title: Episode 1 (intervals)
item.description:
Name the interval. You will hear the two notes played simultaneously twice followed by the answer. The answer will be within two octaves.
-Skip examples by double clicking on the middle button on your ipod -Listen back to examples by triple clicking the middle button on your ipod
item.dc:creator: Danny Wolf
item.itunes:summary:
Name the interval. You will hear the two notes played simultaneously twice followed by the answer. The answer will be within two octaves.
